welcome.translation[0].definitions[0].de: used to greet someone who has just arrived
welcome.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Welcome back – it’s good to see you again.
welcome.translation[1].definitions[0].de: if someone is welcome in a place, other people are glad that they are there
welcome.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: I had the feeling I wasn’t really welcome.
I didn’t feel welcome in the club.
We try to make the new students feel welcome.
welcome.translation[1].definitions[1].de: if something is welcome, you enjoy it because you feel that you need it
welcome.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: The weekend was a welcome break from the pressures of work.
Six months in Scotland would make a welcome change from London.
A cup of tea would be very welcome.
welcome.translation[1].definitions[2].de: if something is welcome, you are glad that it has happened
welcome.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: The increase in interest rates is welcome news for investors.
This new funding will come as a welcome boost for the industry.
welcome.translation[2].definitions[0].de: to say hello in a friendly way to someone who has just arrived
welcome.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: I must be there to welcome my guests.
His family welcomed me with open arms (=in a very friendly way).
welcome.translation[2].definitions[1].de: to be glad to accept something
welcome.translation[2].definitions[1].ex: The college welcomes applications from people of all races.
We would welcome any advice or suggestions with open arms.
welcome.translation[2].definitions[2].de: to be glad that something has happened because you think it is a good idea
welcome.translation[2].definitions[2].ex: Economists have welcomed the decision to raise interest rates.
welcome.translation[3].definitions[0].de: the way in which you greet someone when they arrive at a place
welcome.translation[3].definitions[0].ex: The president got a tremendous welcome at the airport.
His colleagues gave him a very warm welcome when he returned to work.
You can be sure of a friendly welcome at all our hotels.
welcome.translation[3].definitions[1].de: the way in which people react to an idea, and show that they like it or do not like it
welcome.translation[3].definitions[1].ex: Politicians have given an enthusiastic welcome to the Queen’s speech.
The proposals have so far received a cautious welcome from government ministers.
welcome.translation[3].note_box[0].secti: You can be sure of a warm welcome.
They had planned a big welcome for Martin.
Visitors were given a great welcome.
He returned to his homeland to a rapturous welcome in 1996
The pope received a tumultuous welcome.
The audience gave the band a rousing welcome.
The owner offers a hearty welcome to guests.
The Queen was given a decent welcome by the crowd.
Staff and students extended a warm welcome to visiting parents.
His wrinkled face broke into a smile of welcome.
The mayor made a brief speech of welcome.
